Name: privacy_preserving_analytics
Title: Enhancing Japanese Banking Through Privacy-Preserving Data Analytics
Description: The study will explore the potential of privacy-preserving data analytics technologies, such as homomorphic encryption and differential privacy, in the Japanese banking sector. It will investigate how these technologies can be used to leverage customer data while respecting strict privacy expectations and legal requirements. The research will involve reviewing existing literature, case studies from other countries, potential implementation strategies in Japan, and assessing the readiness and willingness of Japanese banks to adopt these technologies. The aim is to identify the benefits, challenges, and policy implications of adopting these technologies in Japanese banks.

Name: ai_governance_framework
Title: Establishing an Ethical AI Governance Framework for Japanese Banks
Description: This research focuses on creating a governance framework for the implementation of artificial intelligence in Japanese banks. It will include examining global practices, stakeholder perceptions in Japan, and ethical considerations. The study aims to offer guidelines that balance AI innovation with transparency, accountability, and fairness, thereby enhancing customer trust and operational efficiency in the banking sector. The research will involve structured surveys and interviews with industry stakeholders and collaboration with academic and regulatory bodies to ensure the framework is both credible and practical.
